text: How to change variables in Python

I have a global variable declared at the start of the program and I want to change the variable in different functions down the program.
I can do this by declaring the variable inside the function again but I would like to know is there a better way of doing this.
Some test code is below to explain what I mean.

code:

project = ("Yep"+ID) #ID added with no value which I later want to change

    #I could declare project again to get this to work, but I would like to avoid this
    print project # I want this to print with the new ID number.

if __name__ == '__main__':
